alert.note: Alert for Clay; Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 3:44AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Laurel, west central Owsley, southwestern Estill, northeastern Pulaski, Jackson, Rockcastle and northwestern Clay Counties through 430 AM EDT... At 343 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Shirley to 6 miles west of Gum Sulphur. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Shirley, Morrill, Locust Branch and Disputanta around 350 AM EDT. Kerby Knob, Ottowa, Bee Lick, Hisel, Clover Bottom, Alcorn, Threelinks, Blanton Flats, Climax and Hiatt around 355 AM EDT. Bromo, Willailla, Sandgap, Collingsworth, Quail, Waneta, Level Green, Wabp, Spiro and Brazil around 400 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hansford, Hurley, Sand Springs, Macedonia, Wellhope, Loam, Dango, Lakes, Burr, Wind Cave, McKee, Bloss, Atkinstown, Pongo, Gray Hawk, Bradshaw, Shop Branch, Dabolt, Luner, Deese, Billows, Mildred, Settle Store, Olin, Annville, Welchburg, Tyner, Zekes Point, Bond, Herd, Egypt, High Knob, Shepherdtown, Datha, Royrader, Green Hill, Bernstadt, Maulden, Sourwood, Nathanton, London, Bunch, Malcomb, Sacker Gap, Fogertown, Chestnutburg, Benge, Sextons Creek and Crawford. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 35 and 72. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 35 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle
